change_description:
This implementation class will be hidden in Lucene 5.0.
   Use Analyzer.GLOBAL_REUSE_STRATEGY instead!

This implementation class will be hidden in Lucene 5.0.
   Use Analyzer.PER_FIELD_REUSE_STRATEGY instead!

Implement TermToBytesRefAttribute and store bytes directly
 instead. This class will be removed in Lucene 5.0

(4.0) This is only used to read indexes created
 before 4.0.
Only for reading old 4.0 and 4.1 segments
Only for reading old 4.0 and 4.1 segments
Only for reading old 4.0 and 4.1 segments

This is here only to ease transition from
  the pre-4.0 APIs.

This is here only to ease transition from
  the pre-4.0 APIs.
This constant is no longer used since Lucene 4.5.
With Lucene 4.0, we are always on Java 6
(4.4) Index as a numeric field using IntField and then use FieldCache.getInts(AtomicReader, String, boolean) instead.
(4.4) Index as a numeric field using IntField and then use FieldCache.getInts(AtomicReader, String, boolean) instead.
This is no longer used since Lucene 4.5.
(4.4) Index as a numeric field using IntField and then use FieldCache.getInts(AtomicReader, String, boolean) instead.
(4.4) Index as a numeric field using IntField and then use FieldCache.getInts(AtomicReader, String, boolean) instead.

iterate fields and add their size() instead. 
   this method is only provided as a transition mechanism
   to access this statistic for 3.x indexes, which do not
   have this statistic per-field.
This comparator is only a transition mechanism
This comparator is only a transition mechanism

(4.0) use AtomicReader.getFieldInfos() and check FieldInfo.hasNorms() 
                   for the field instead.
Only for reading CFS files from 3.x indexes.
(4.1) This method will be removed in Lucene 5.0
This is no longer used since Lucene 4.5.

This is here only to ease transition from
 the pre-4.0 APIs.
Don't create instances of this class, use Analyzer.GLOBAL_REUSE_STRATEGY
Don't create instances of this class, use Analyzer.PER_FIELD_REUSE_STRATEGY

Use AnalyzerWrapper.AnalyzerWrapper(Analyzer.ReuseStrategy)
 and specify a valid Analyzer.ReuseStrategy, probably retrieved from the
 wrapped analyzer using Analyzer.getReuseStrategy().

(3.1) Use StandardAnalyzer instead, which has the same functionality.
 This analyzer will be removed in Lucene 5.0

(3.1) Use StopFilter instead, which has the same functionality.
 This filter will be removed in Lucene 5.0

(3.1) Use StandardTokenizer instead, which has the same functionality.
 This filter will be removed in Lucene 5.0
Use StandardTokenizer, CJKWidthFilter, CJKBigramFilter, and LowerCaseFilter instead.

Use CollationAttributeFactory instead, which encodes
  terms directly as bytes. This filter will be removed in Lucene 5.0

(3.1) Use SnowballFilter with 
 DutchStemmer instead, which has the
 same functionality. This filter will be removed in Lucene 5.0

(3.1) Use DutchStemmer instead, 
 which has the same functionality. This filter will be removed in Lucene 5.0

(3.1) Use SnowballFilter with 
 FrenchStemmer instead, which has the
 same functionality. This filter will be removed in Lucene 5.0

Use FrenchStemmer instead, 
 which has the same functionality. This filter will be removed in Lucene 4.0
(4.0) use the pattern-based analysis in the analysis/pattern package instead.

(4.4) PositionFilter makes TokenStream graphs inconsistent
             which can cause highlighting bugs. Its main use-case being to make
             QueryParser
             generate boolean queries instead of phrase queries, it is now advised to use
             QueryParser.setAutoGeneratePhraseQueries(boolean)
             (for simple cases) or to override QueryParser.newFieldQuery.

(3.1) Use StandardTokenizer instead, which has the same functionality.
 This filter will be removed in Lucene 5.0

Use StandardTokenizerFactory instead.
  This tokenizer has no Russian-specific functionality.

(3.1) Use the language-specific analyzer in modules/analysis instead. 
 This analyzer will be removed in Lucene 5.0
This class is only for exact backwards compatibility
This class is only for exact backwards compatibility
This class is only for exact backwards compatibility
This class is only for exact backwards compatibility
This class is only for exact backwards compatibility
enablePositionIncrements=false is not supported anymore as of Lucene 4.4

Use CollationKeyAnalyzer.CollationKeyAnalyzer(Version, Collator)
   and specify a version instead. This ctor will be removed in Lucene 5.0
enablePositionIncrements=false is not supported anymore as of Lucene 4.4
enablePositionIncrements=false is not supported anymore as of Lucene 4.4.
enablePositionIncrements=false is not supported anymore as of Lucene 4.4.
Offset updates are not supported anymore as of Lucene 4.4.
enablePositionIncrements=false is not supported anymore as of Lucene 4.4.
enablePositionIncrements=false is not supported anymore as of Lucene 4.4.

Use ICUCollationAttributeFactory instead, which encodes
  terms directly as bytes. This filter will be removed in Lucene 5.0

Use ICUCollationKeyAnalyzer.ICUCollationKeyAnalyzer(Version, Collator)
   and specify a version instead. This ctor will be removed in Lucene 5.0
enablePositionIncrements=false is not supported anymore as of Lucene 4.4.

This codec is read-only: as the functionality has been folded
 into the default codec. Its only for convenience to read old segments.
Only for reading old Appending segments

(March 2011) Not normally used, to be removed from Lucene 4.0.
   This class implementing Comparable is to be removed at the same time.

Index collation keys with CollationKeyAnalyzer or ICUCollationKeyAnalyzer instead.
 This class will be removed in Lucene 5.0

Index collation keys with CollationKeyAnalyzer or ICUCollationKeyAnalyzer instead.
 This class will be removed in Lucene 5.0

Index collation keys with CollationKeyAnalyzer or ICUCollationKeyAnalyzer instead.
 This class will be removed in Lucene 5.0

Index collation keys with CollationKeyAnalyzer or ICUCollationKeyAnalyzer instead.
  This class will be removed in Lucene 5.0
